185980253.review:
[quote=из к/ф «Дэнни Цепной пес»]По сути, вы превратили человека в собаку.[/quote]

В конце сентября 2017 года польская студия [b]Reikon Games[/b] выпустила свой дебютный проект [b]Ruiner[/b]. Первая ассоциации от игры  — hardcore action сильно напоминающую Hotline Miami, пронизанный стилистикой киберпанка.
К слову, популяризация киберпанка в массовой культуре была весьма актуальна, так как темы и проблемы, поднимаемые жанром, остро отзывались в 2017 году. 

[b]СЮЖЕТ[/b]
[code]Сюжет в [b]Ruiner[/b] прост и понятен. События игры происходят в 2091 году в Ренгкоке и его окрестностях, принадлежащих Heaven, конгломерату во главе с человеком, которого в игре называют Боссом.
В качестве главного героя выступает персонаж без имени и предыстории, который буквально врывается в кадр с одной миссией — убить Босса. После неудачной попытки убийства, герой узнаёт о похищении своего брата и в последующем пытается спасти его из разорившегося конгломерата, известного как Небеса.[/code]

[b]ГЕЙМПЛЕЙ[/b]
[code]Игровой процесс представляет из себя классический top-down shooter с небольшими отличиями в управлении персонажем и определёнными особенностями в его усовершенствовании. Говоря об управлении, стоит отметить, что в [b]Ruiner[/b] оно достаточно отзывчивое, а система обычных атак и «кинетических» усилений (по типу «рывка») делает бои более зрелищными и динамичными. В конце каждого боя игроку начисляется «карма» (опыт), количество которого зависит от того, как хорошо игрок провёл сражение.
Однако за красивыми боями скрывается высокий уровень сложности, даже на на самом простом уровне, что в свою очередь создаёт сильное напряжение и заставляет серьёзно попотеть игроков, особенно при встрече с боссами.[/code]

[b]ПЛЮСЫ[/b]
[list]
    [*]скоростные сражения, требующие от игрока быстрой реакции, мышления и осторожности ;
    [*]гибкая система развития персонажа, позволяющая игрокам экспериментировать с тактикой боя;
    [*]выразительная стилистика классического киберпанка;
    [*]драйвовое музыкальное сопровождение, которое отлично дополняет игровую атмосферу и превращает боевые сцены в изумительные танцы смерти;
    [*]интересная атмосфера и симпатичная графика;
    [*]отполированный до блеска геймплей.
[/list]

[b]МИНУСЫ[/b]
[list]
    [*]не всегда понятное управление и поведение персонажей в ряде ситуаций;
    [*]отсутствие сюжета в игре.
[/list]

[b]ИТОГ[/b]
Игру [b]Ruiner[/b] нельзя назвать выдающимся примером поднявшего жанр на новый уровень. И хотя он не идеален, это не делает его менее привлекательным. Потому как [b]Ruiner[/b] - это необычайно стильная игра, с безумным геймплеем и задорной музыкой, способная увлечь игрока не на один час.

[h3][b]Ruiner[/b] - посредственная, но зрелещная мясорубка, которую стоит пройти хотя бы несколько раз.[/h3]

185510947.review:
When I bought the game, I thought about a top-down shooter and a cyberpunk theme in first place.
But I didn't know that it's a hack and slash game, which I actually hate. Still I finished the game on hard level difficulty...
Gameplay is super cool. You are free to change your skills any moment to try different combinations. There are many different weapons: swords, maces, machineguns, flamethrowers, lasers, frostgun, etc.
Visuals are good, but I think that there is WAY TOO MUCH of red color and I believe that some animations may cause epilepsy. Also I wish level appearance would be more diverse.
Game is pretty short but still has nice plot. Characters are funny.
Also I would say that the game is well optimized - usually it takes a second too respawn after death and jump into battle again.
BRUTAL AND DYNAMIC!

185305990.review:
This is genuinely a fun game if you know what you're getting into, overall a B+ for sure, mayyybe A-, so like a 7/10, but a good 7/10, mayyybe even 8/10, but its obviously not a large budget massive game, but not buggy or boring or anything, I could give it an 8/10 I suppose 
Gameplay-wise its played like an isometric hack and slash, where reaction and speed is important, its important to react to and dodge enemy attacks, you must act fast but also mindfully, there is a dodge that doesn’t give you immunity so you must avoid attacks, you also get a v effective shield and the ability to see everything slower, and ofc a bunch of other skills, I WOULD QUALIFY THIS AS A DIFFICULT GAME, and I’m writing this in all caps as a warning to someone who wants something more fun and chill, much like you must account for every attack in soulslikes, this is way different but you must act very fast to both avoid many strong attacks, even from weaker mobs, and attack the enemies
Story-wise its a decent cyberpunk dystopian story, dark enough, original, interesting enough

+ great world building 
+ good art style and decent graphics
+ good sound design with a great soundtrack for this sort of a game
+ a fun experience, completable in a day, doesn’t take forever doing things, and even the more repetitive bits don’t get boring
+ quick, action packed and speed-based combat 
- dialog options that dont matter 
- flawed story, overall decent, but at some point loses any symbolism and is just fascinating things happening for the sake of a fun story, but that’s not a horrible thing, its alright, but i feel it could be even better given the world building
- sometimes gets button-mashy and hard to follow through even though the controls start to feel clunky
- to reiterate the previous point, YOUR CHARACTER DOES NOT MELEE IN THE DIRECTION YOURE RUNNING, YOU STILL NEED TO TURN THE RIGHT STICK, which gets really annoying on a controller
- sometimes gets a bit annoying in combat, but that’s a minor drawback, as I have seen FAR, FAR more annoying parts in great games

É repetitivo, o combate é delayzento, inimigos com skills totalmente nonsense (os bichos desaparecem quando vc dá hit e aparecem depois atrás de vc cuspindo bala, às vezes eles morrem com o hit, mas desaparecem e aparecem atrás de vc, dão 2 tiros e só depois caem). 184541304.review: 一款畅快刺激的游戏，流程稍微短，八个小时就一周目了，有新游戏+的玩法我暂时没有体验，剧情很有意思，弟弟最后战胜了自己...音乐方面也非常赞，结合游戏背景设定的话，真的很好听，游戏打击感好强，处决好爽，建议多玩近战，双摇杆操作可能需要适应适应。后续有点重复，堆怪稍微有点多，不过还好，还是值得推荐的

184479031.review:
I got this on sale for 3 bucks, and I'd say that's a pretty good deal, but i probably wouldn't pay much more for it. the art is good, but the sheer amount of visual effects completely drown out all visual cues. it's hard to tell when you're taking damage, it's hard to tell where the enemies are, it's hard to tell whether your shield is even up, especially when the teleporting enemies start showing up. At any given time, there are about 3 explosions happening onscreen. It's hard to tell when I'm low on energy or health. If there's an audio cue, i certainly wasn't able to hear it over the music, enemy dialogue, and explosions. When I die, I'm often not entirely sure what happened. There's also a huge difficulty spike with one random miniboss around halfway through the game, it took me about 3x as many attempts as the final boss
The story also doesn't make much sense. There's a twist that comes out of nowhere at the very end and it's more comical than anything. You never really interact with a character more than, like, 3 times other than the lady in your head, who I don't think is ever actually given a name. Your whole goal is to save a brother you have no emotional attachment to, and once you do it, the game just ends. The game is 5 hours long, and the last 10 minutes felt super rushed, but honestly, I'm thankful it didn't keep going, because the gameplay loop was wearing pretty thin. Also, the skill tree gave me the impression that the game would be a lot longer. by the time I beat the game, I only had, like, a third of the skills. Even the ones I did unlock, most of them seemed pretty impractical, and I never really had any reason to use any abilities other than the shield.
The game is severely unpolished. A lot of things feel tacked on and incomplete. Maybe, given more time, it could have been something more, but as it stands, this is a cool 2 hour game that was stretched into a pretty not great 5 hour game.

184453425.review: Great fun, great gameplay, cool story. I'd compare it to Hardcore Henry in game form, but with a cyberpunk theme. Doesn't get lost in the weeds of the story, just lets it act as a vessel for the gameplay. The pace is fast, the humor dark, and despite it's small size it does a good job world building and making it feel real and lived in. Only complaint is a positive, too short! Would love to tear through more levels.
